inclusion.criterion: positive for HCV RNA on testing with the polymerase chain reaction (quantitative test), or qualitative test positive if quantitative negative
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: have undergone a liver biopsy within one year before entry, available for analysis and whose results are consistent with a diagnosis of chronic hepatitis with at least moderate inflammation, a fibrosis score of at least 2/6 according to Ishak et al (1995), and excluding complete cirrhosis
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: In terms of drinking, the men comprise "abstainers" (less than 12 drinks in the past year), those who drink lightly (1-13 drinks per month) or moderately (4-14 drinks per week)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: For women below the age of 50 years, these levels are reduced in half. A drink is defined as: 12 ounces of regular beer, 5 ounces of wine or 1.5 ounces of distilled spirits (80 proof)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: HCV Cirrhosis (tx with interferon x2 with no response)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Recent admission: UGIB non-steroidal induced gastritis
inclusion.label: met

notes: Patient has HCV Cirrhosis, Grade II Esophageal varices, and recent admission for UGIB. He is being treated with lactulose for hepatic encephalopathy.
